docs.abstract: In the 1960s, she and her husband galvanized black residents, who were underrepresented in politics and saw high rates of incarceration and unemployment.
docs.snippet: In the 1960s, she and her husband galvanized black residents, who were underrepresented in politics and saw high rates of incarceration and unemployment.
docs.lead_paragraph: Joan Jones, a low-key but determined crusader for racial justice and equality in Nova Scotia, whose black population has faced discrimination and hostility for centuries, died on April 1 in Halifax, the capital of the province. She was 79.

headline.main: Joan Jones, 79, Force Against Racism in Nova Scotia, Dies
headline.print_headline: Joan Jones, 79, Who Fought Racism in Nova Scotia, Dies

docs.lead_paragraph: Joe Biden’s father led the high life as a young man: yachts, fast cars, polo. But his fortunes ran out, thanks to a few bad business deals.

docs.abstract: Mr. Buttigieg said Thursday that he had not understood at the time that the phrase had become a sort of counter-slogan to the Black Lives Matter movement.
docs.snippet: Mr. Buttigieg said Thursday that he had not understood at the time that the phrase had become a sort of counter-slogan to the Black Lives Matter movement.
docs.lead_paragraph: It was March 2015, and Mayor Pete Buttigieg of South Bend, Ind., recognized that the country was having what he called a “painful dialogue” about how people of color and law enforcement were coexisting in their communities. The Black Lives Matter movement was growing in influence after several high-profile killings of black men by police officers.

headline.main: Pete Buttigieg Faces Scrutiny Over ‘All Lives Matter’ Remark in 2015
headline.print_headline: Three Words From 2015  Scrutinized  In 2020 Bid

docs.abstract: Jackie Sibblies Drury, Jeremy O. Harris, Antoinette Nwandu and Jordan E. Cooper, on influences, gatekeepers and helping “the young black theater nerd find work that looks like them.”
docs.snippet: Jackie Sibblies Drury, Jeremy O. Harris, Antoinette Nwandu and Jordan E. Cooper, on influences, gatekeepers and helping “the young black theater nerd find work that looks like them.”
docs.lead_paragraph: They are the talk of the theater world: a generation of black playwrights whose fiercely political and formally inventive works are challenging audiences, critics and the culture at large to think about race, and racism, in new ways.

headline.main: How These Black Playwrights Are Challenging American Theater

byline.original: By Michael Paulson and Nicole Herrington

docs.snippet: Arthur C. Brooks, in “Love Your Enemies,” offers advice on how to restore civility to American politics.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOVE YOUR ENEMIES How Decent People Can Save America From the Culture of Contempt By Arthur C. Brooks

headline.main: Healing the Divisions in Our Country

docs.abstract: One of the seminal films of its era, it was cinema’s answer to the Rodney King story.
docs.snippet: One of the seminal films of its era, it was cinema’s answer to the Rodney King story.
docs.lead_paragraph: “Boyz N the Hood” was John Singleton’s debut film. It came out in 1991 when he was just 23 years old. The director, who died yesterday at the age of 51 after suffering a stroke, went on to make several great films but none rival his first, one of the seminal films of its era.

headline.main: What John Singleton Accomplished With ‘Boyz N the Hood’
headline.print_headline: A Film That Captured Black Lives

docs.abstract: Parker’s third collection provides its audience a space to celebrate black excellence and black joy as well as to commiserate about injustice.
docs.snippet: Parker’s third collection provides its audience a space to celebrate black excellence and black joy as well as to commiserate about injustice.

headline.main: In ‘Magical Negro,’ Morgan Parker’s Poems Challenge White Ideas of Blackness

docs.abstract: A perceived victory for Russian interference poses a serious risk for the United States.
docs.snippet: A perceived victory for Russian interference poses a serious risk for the United States.
docs.lead_paragraph: The report of the special counsel Robert Mueller leaves considerable space for partisan warfare over the role of President Trump and his political campaign in Russia’s interference in the 2016 election. But one conclusion is categorical: “The Russian government interfered in the 2016 presidential election in sweeping and systematic fashion.”

headline.main: The Mueller Report and the Danger Facing American Democracy

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

docs.abstract: France’s so-called Yellow Vest protesters are animated by more than anger at the rich: They seek a protected and expanded social safety net.
docs.snippet: France’s so-called Yellow Vest protesters are animated by more than anger at the rich: They seek a protected and expanded social safety net.
docs.lead_paragraph: BOURGES, France — In a world seething with anger over the widening gap between the rich and everyone else, France stands out as a country elaborately engineered to protect social peace.

headline.main: Inequality Fuels Rage of ‘Yellow Vests’ in Equality-Obsessed France
headline.print_headline: Rage of ‘Yellow Vests’ in France Intensifies Over People Left Behind
